From: "Dinwiddie, George" <George.Dinwiddie@...>

Thanks, all for the tips.  I'd already looked over much of the Jakarta 
site and looked at the build for Ant.  I've just signed up with ant-user.
Stefan, at first glance the "Ant in Anger" doc looks very good; I'll
reread it carefully.  I didn't notice any "get" and "commit" targets 
mentioned, though.

This brings me to the point that's making it especially difficult
for me.  Due to circumstances beyond my control, I'm trying to get
Ant to interface with PVCS.  Why not do things the hard way?  Why
not try to extend something when you've no experience using it?
Why not use a clumsy, proprietary source code control when a free
one is available?  <sigh>  I'll go back to my chore, now.

Thanks, sincerely,
  George

-----Original Message-----
From: Stefan Bodewig [mailto:bodewig@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 05, 2001 2:45 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] OT: getting started with Ant


George Dinwiddie <George.Dinwiddie@...> wrote:

> Can anyone give me pointers on getting started with Ant?

I'd start out with Ant's manual - reading the examples and building up
your own build-environments very slowly.  

Recent Ant's (i.e. 1.3 and above) have a document named "Ant in Anger:
Using Ant in a Production Environment" in the docs directory, this is
not really something for the total beginner, but a very good reading
for those who have grasped the basic concepts of Ant.  You can get the
latest version from CVS
<http://jakarta.apache.org/cvsweb/index.cgi/~checkout~/jakarta-ant/docs/ant_
in_anger.html?rev=1.3&content-type=text/html>.

Finally, join ant-user and ask questions there, I think the people
there are very supportive, but I'm biased.

Cheers

        Stefan
